com.here.android.mpa.routing

Class Signpost.LocalizedLabel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.routing.Signpost.LocalizedLabel
  • Enclosing class:
    Signpost

    public static final class Signpost.LocalizedLabel
extends java.lang.Object
    Signpost information can be used for navigation (both audible and graphical/textual navigation) and map display. In Europe, the label Text is most relevant for guidance, while in the North America, both Route Name and Direction information are most relevant.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getLanguage()
      Three letter MARC language tag.
      java.lang.String getRouteDirection()
      Contains the cardinal direction.
      java.lang.String getRouteName()
      Contains the route name/route number of the label.
      java.lang.String getText()
      Usually it contains auxiliary information like city name or characteristic place (for example: "airport").
      java.lang.String toString()

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getLanguage

        public java.lang.String getLanguage()
        Three letter MARC language tag.
        Returns:
        A string representing the language.

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Usually it contains auxiliary information like city name or characteristic place (for example: "airport").
        Returns:
        String with auxilary information.

      • getRouteName

        public java.lang.String getRouteName()
        Contains the route name/route number of the label. Since the origin data is not always consistent it is advisable to concatenate the route name and route direction fields There are for example cases in which the direction is already contained in the route name.
        Returns:
        String with the route name.
        See Also:
        Signpost.LocalizedLabel.getRouteName(), Signpost.LocalizedLabel.getRouteDirection()

      • getRouteDirection

        public java.lang.String getRouteDirection()
        Contains the cardinal direction.
        Returns:
        String with the direction.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
